benchmark_details.name: Collu-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: A benchmark for predicting code hallucinations of LLMs across code generation (CG) and automated program repair (APR) tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and analyze code hallucinations in LLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The errors in the target hallucination token index due to automated pipeline challenges.

data.source: Five datasets: MBPP, HumanEval, HumanEval-Java, Defects4J, SWE-bench
data.annotation: Includes features such as per-step log probabilities, token types, and execution feedback

methodology.calculation: Accuracy calculated based on hallucination localization predictions
methodology.interpretation: Results highlight the complex nature of predicting hallucinations with achieved accuracies ranging from 22.03% to 33.15%.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through cross-validation with multiple setups (All-in-one, One-per-dataset, One-per-LLM).

targeted_risks.harm: Incorrect and vulnerable code leading to significant financial loss.
